intro: Gnidia sericea var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth gnidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silver-green, hairy leaves that become smoother as the plant matures. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact cluster, which bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodland or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
